metadata.title: CVE-2023-35001 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Linux Kernel nftables Out-Of-Bounds Read/Write Vulnerability; nft_byteorderpoorly handled vm register contents when CAP_NET_ADMIN is in any user ornetwork namespace

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-155-generic - 5.4.0-155.172~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-214.225').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-155.172~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1143.148').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.172').
